lib/lb/cbap.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Contrained bottleneck assignment problem algorithm
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the contrained bottleneck assignment problem (CBAP) 
00005  *  that's used as a lower bound for the contrained BTSP objective value.
00006  *
00007  *  NOTE: This code is an almost verbatim copy of C++ code written by Jonker
00008  *  (a copy may be found at http://www.magiclogic.com/assignment.html).
00009  *  The code will not compile along side Concorde, and requires a full cost
00010  *  matrix (which we need to avoid for large problems).  Therefore, the best
00011  *  option was to implement a C version using our problem data structure.
00012  *
00013  *  This code is explained in the paper:
00014  *  "A Shortest Augmenting Path Algorithm for Dense and Sparse Linear 
00015  *  Assignment Problems," Computing 38, 325-340, 1987 by
00016  *  R. Jonker and A. Volgenant, University of Amsterdam.
00017  *
00018  *  @author  John LaRusic
00019  *  @ingroup lib
00020  ****************************************************************************/
00021 #include "common.h"
00022 #include "lb.h"
00023

00047 /****************************************************************************
00048  * Private function implementations
00049  ****************************************************************************/
00050 int
00051 arrow_cbap_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00052                  double max_length, arrow_bound_result *result)
00053 {
00054     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00055     int n = problem->size * 2;
00056     int i, cost, max_cost;
00057     int low, high, median, delta;
00058     int *x, *y, *pi, *d, *pred, *label;
00059     double length;
00060     double start_time, end_time;
00061     arrow_heap heap;
00062     
00063     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00064     
00065     if(!init_data(n, &x, &y, &pi, &d, &pred, &label, &heap))
00066     {
00067         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00068         goto CLEANUP;
00069     }
00070     
00071     /* Initial LAP call */
00072     length = lap(problem, INT_MAX, x, y, pi, d, pred, label, &heap);
00073     if(length > max_length)
00074     {
00075         arrow_print_error("Given max_length is infeasible.\n");
00076         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00077         goto CLEANUP;
00078     }
00079     arrow_debug("Initial LAP solution: %.0f\n", length);
00080     
00081     /* Find the largest cost in the assignment.  It will be our
00082        upper bound for the binary search. */
00083     max_cost = INT_MIN;
00084     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00085     {
00086         cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, x[i]);
00087         if(cost > max_cost)
00088             max_cost = cost;
00089     }
00090     
00091     if(!arrow_util_binary_search(info->cost_list, info->cost_list_length,
00092                                 max_cost, &high))
00093     {
00094         arrow_print_error("Could not find max_cost in cost_list");
00095         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00096         goto CLEANUP;
00097     }
00098     low = 0;
00099     
00100     while(low != high)
00101     {
00102         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00103         delta = info->cost_list[median];
00104         
00105         length = lap(problem, delta, x, y, pi, d, pred, label, &heap);
00106         
00107         if(length <= max_length)
00108             high = median;
00109         else
00110             low = median + 1;
00111     }
00112     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00113     
00114     /* Return the cost we converged to as the answer */
00115     result->obj_value = info->cost_list[low];
00116     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00117 
00118 CLEANUP:
00119     destruct_data(&x, &y, &pi, &d, &pred, &label, &heap);
00120     return ret;
00121 }
00122 
00123 int
00124 arrow_cbap_lap(arrow_problem *problem, double *result)
00125 {
00126     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00127     int n = problem->size * 2;
00128     int *x, *y, *pi, *d, *pred, *label;
00129     arrow_heap heap;
00130     
00131     if(!init_data(n, &x, &y, &pi, &d, &pred, &label, &heap))
00132     {
00133         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00134         goto CLEANUP;
00135     }
00136     
00137     *result = lap(problem, INT_MAX, x, y, pi, d, pred, label, &heap);
00138 
00139 CLEANUP:
00140     destruct_data(&x, &y, &pi, &d, &pred, &label, &heap);
00141     return ret;
00142 }

00145 /****************************************************************************
00146  * Private function implementations
00147  ****************************************************************************/
00148 int
00149 init_data(int n, int **x, int **y, int **pi, int **d, int **pred, int **label,
00150           arrow_heap *heap)
00151 {
00152     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, x))
00153         goto CLEANUP;
00154     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, y))
00155         goto CLEANUP;
00156     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, pi))
00157         goto CLEANUP;
00158     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, d))
00159         goto CLEANUP;
00160     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, pred))
00161         goto CLEANUP;
00162     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, label))
00163         goto CLEANUP;
00164     if(!arrow_heap_init(heap, n))
00165         goto CLEANUP;
00166     
00167     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00168     
00169 CLEANUP:
00170     destruct_data(x, y, pi, d, pred, label, heap);
00171     return ARROW_FAILURE;
00172 }
00173 
00174 void
00175 destruct_data(int **x, int **y, int **pi, int **d, int **pred, int **label,
00176               arrow_heap *heap)
00177 {
00178     if(*x != NULL) free(*x);
00179     if(*y != NULL) free(*y);
00180     if(*pi != NULL) free(*pi);
00181     if(*d != NULL) free(*d);
00182     if(*pred != NULL) free(*pred);
00183     if(*label != NULL) free(*label);
00184     arrow_heap_destruct(heap);
00185 }
00186 
00187 double
00188 lap(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int *x, int *y, 
00189     int *pi, int *d, int *pred, int *label, arrow_heap *heap)
00190 {
00191     int i, j, t;
00192     int n = problem->size;
00193     
00194     /* Initialization */
00195     for(i = 0; i < 2 * n; i++)
00196     {
00197         x[i] = -1;
00198         y[i] = -1;
00199         pi[i] = 0;
00200     }
00201         
00202     for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00203     {
00204         /* Find the shortest path from i to any demand node t */
00205         dijkstra(problem, delta, x, y, pi, i, &t, d, pred, label, heap);
00206         
00207         /* If we cannot reach a demand node then problem's infeasible */
00208         if(t == -1) return DBL_MAX;
00209         
00210         /* Update reduced costs */
00211         for(j = 0; j < 2 * n; j++)
00212         {
00213             if(label[j])
00214                 pi[j] = pi[j] - d[j] + d[t];
00215         }
00216         
00217         /* Augment! */
00218         augment(problem, i, t, pred, x, y);
00219     }
00220     
00221     /* Calculate total cost of assignment, as well as fix final solution. */
00222     double cost = 0.0;
00223     for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00224     {
00225         x[i] = x[i] - n;
00226         cost += problem->get_cost(problem, i, x[i]);
00227     }
00228     return cost;
00229 }
00230 
00231 void
00232 dijkstra(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int *x, int *y, int *pi, int s, 
00233          int *t, int *d, int *pred, int *label, arrow_heap *heap)
00234 {
00235     int i, j, u, v;
00236     int start, stop, admissable;
00237     int cost, red_cost;
00238     int n = problem->size;
00239     
00240     /* Initialization */
00241     arrow_heap_empty(heap);
00242     for(i = 0; i < 2 * n; i++)
00243     {
00244         d[i] = INT_MAX;
00245         pred[i] = -1;
00246         label[i] = 0;
00247     }
00248     d[s] = 0;
00249     arrow_heap_insert(heap, 0, s);
00250     
00251     /* Main loop for Dijkstra */
00252     while(heap->size > 0)
00253     {
00254         i = arrow_heap_get_min(heap);
00255         arrow_heap_delete_min(heap);
00256         
00257         if(i < n)
00258         {
00259             start = n;
00260             stop = 2 * n - 1;
00261         }
00262         else
00263         {
00264             start = 0;
00265             stop = n - 1;
00266         } 
00267 
00268         label[i] = 1;
00269         
00270         /* If we've reached an unassigned demand node, we can stop */
00271         if((i >= n) && (y[i] == -1))
00272         {
00273             *t = i;
00274             return;
00275         }
00276             
00277         /* Iterate through neighbouring nodes */
00278         u = (i < n ? i : i - n);
00279         for(j = start; j <= stop; j++)
00280         {
00281             v = (j < n ? j : j - n);
00282             
00283             if(i < n)
00284                 admissable = (x[i] != j);
00285             else
00286                 admissable = (x[j] == i);
00287             
00288             if((u != v) && (admissable) && (!label[j]))
00289             {
00290                 if(i >= n)
00291                     cost = problem->get_cost(problem, v, u);
00292                 else
00293                     cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00294                                 
00295                 if(cost <= delta)
00296                 {
00297                     if(i >= n) cost = cost * -1;
00298                     red_cost = cost - pi[i] + pi[j];
00299                     
00300                     if(red_cost < 0)
00301                     {
00302                         arrow_print_error("Negative reduced cost!");
00303                         *t = -1;
00304                         return;
00305                     }
00306                     
00307                     if(red_cost + d[i] < d[j])
00308                     {
00309                         d[j] = red_cost + d[i];
00310                         pred[j] = i;
00311                         
00312                         if(arrow_heap_in(heap, j))
00313                             arrow_heap_change_key(heap, d[j], j);
00314                         else
00315                             arrow_heap_insert(heap, d[j], j);
00316                     }
00317                 }
00318             }
00319         }
00320     }
00321     
00322     /* At this point, we've not encountered an unassigned demand node */
00323     *t = -1;
00324 }
00325 
00326 void
00327 augment(arrow_problem *problem, int s, int t, int *pred, int *x, int *y)
00328 {
00329     int u, v;
00330     v = t;
00331     while(v != s)
00332     {
00333         u = pred[v];
00334         x[u] = v;
00335         y[v] = u;        
00336         v = u;
00337     }
00338 }
